alert.note: Alert for Pope (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 9:06PM CST until January 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY TO FALL ACROSS WESTERN AND SOUTHERN MINNESOTA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... .Moderate to heavy snow will overspread western Minnesota after midnight Thursday night and continue through the day Friday. Snowfall rates could exceed an inch per hour at times. Total snow accumulation of 6 to 12 inches are likely within the Winter Storm Watch area, with amounts tapering off to the east. The heaviest amounts are currently expected on the Buffalo Ridge in southwestern Minnesota. Some questions remain with the eastern extent of the heavy snow, but it appears likely amounts will drop off quickly near the Mississippi River. Watches and eventual warnings could be expanded a little farther east with time. A Winter Storm Watch is in effect late Thursday night through Friday evening west of a line from Glenwood to Mankato. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Pope County. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
